chapter.title: Criteria for choosing
chapter.para: Here are the relevant criteria to consider when choosing our template engine.

simplesect.title: Simplicity & usability
simplesect.para: We want to keep it simple as NickScript is currently. The language should be easy to understand and fast to learn (at least for the basics). It shouldn't require specific skills other than web design / basic web developments.
Form development should be the easiest possible, with clear error messages in case of errors.

simplesect.title: Flexibility
simplesect.para: The system should be flexible enough to cover unexpected use case. It should be able to provide an EvalPerl like feature in a secure fashion.
The system should be easily extensible with a plug-in mechanism.

simplesect.title: Performance
simplesect.para: Rendering a template should be quick, including on the client-side if we choose a Javascript based template engine. How quick ? let's say we want to keep it around 10ms for a start for the default form file.

simplesect.title: Support & community
simplesect.para: Relying on a third party template system saves us having to write and maintain our own. We have to make sure that the one we choose is backed up by a solid community. Relases should be made regularly to fix bugs / add new features, and we have to be able to get community support.
